latest_articles.title: Trump’s Greenland Threats Rattle the Faroe Islands
latest_articles.summary: Many people in the Faroe Islands, a tiny archipelago in the North Atlantic, want to be their own state. The crisis over Greenland, Denmark’s other territory, has complicated that, for now.

latest_articles.title: Here’s How the U.S. Accepted Danish Control of Greenland 100 Years Ago.
latest_articles.summary: In 1917, the United States bought Caribbean islands from Denmark and agreed to respect Denmark’s hold over Greenland. The deal resurfaced with President Trump’s recent threats to seize Greenland.
latest_articles.evidence: U.S. Accepted Danish Control of Greenland 100 Years Ago
